alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:41AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the District of Columbia along Rock Creek. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 AM EST, At 634 AM EST, At 6:30am, the stream gauge at Sherrill Drive was reporting flooding of Rock Creek, with stream level nearly 1 foot above flood stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Locations along Rock Creek... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
